Exact Coloring :-

-> In graph theory, an exact
 coloring is a vertex
 coloring in which every
 pair of colors appears on
 exactly one pair of
 adjacent vertices.

-> That is, it is a partition of
 the vertices of the graph
 into disjoint independent
 sets such that,for each
 pair of distinct
 independent sets in the
 partition,there is exactly
 one edge with endpoints
 in each set.
